questions.question_text:
You are using the Configuration Wizard to create a now domain that will consist of a cluster of a of three managed servers along with an instance of WebLogic server acting as HIPT proxy to distribute traffic to the cluster.
Which three steps should you perform with the Configuration Wizard?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ADE
when creating the cluster, you might need to specify the proxy settings. However, the options given don't mention that. The options F is about specifying a proxy port for the admin server, which may not be related. So F is probably not correct.

Selected Answer: ABE
The admin server is not a managed server, and F does not make sense because it confuses client HTTP access with admin HTTP access

comments.content: I think the Admin Server is indeed NOT a managed server

discussion.content: Even Admin server is also a Managed server

questions.question_text:
You are using the Configuration Wizard to create a new domain that will consist of a cluster of three managed servers along with an instance of WebLogic Server acting as HTTP proxy to distribute traffic to the cluster.
Which three steps should you perform with the Configuration Wizard? (Choose three.)

choices.E: Assign three servers to a cluster.
choices.F: Specify a proxy port for the administration server.

choices.A: There is nothing you can do, since inline help cannot be disabled.
choices.C: Log into the administration console and disable inline help under "help."
choices.B: There is nothing you can do for all users, since disabling inline help must be done per user.
choices.D: Access WLST, connect to the domain's admin server, and use the command EnableInlineHelp (false).

questions.question_text:
All administrators that deal with the production domain in your organization are extremely experienced. As the lead administrator, you have been asked to change the administration console preferences for all administrators so that inline help no longer displays, since no one needs it.
Select the true statement about this scenario.

discussion.content: First off, disabling inline help is under preferences and the user prefernces page is used to specify preferences that will be in effect only for your user account and only in the current domain
Modify the answer please, the correct one is "B"
Administrator is a group. any users can be assigned to this group. Ans is B

Ans is C 
Because I am an administrator I will login using admin creds, for example weblogic. Once I disable Inline help, this setting gets saved for all admins.

comments.content: Falso de toda falsedad. Intenta crear dos usuarios Administradores y haz la prueba

discussion.content: Okay, so the correct answer here is B.
The right answer is B

due too he said all administrators>> he needs to disable only the administrator user
so my answer it will be C

B is the correct answer!
inline help is a setting on a user level
Please let me know which one is correct answer c or B

B
https://docs.oracle.com/cd/E24329_01/apirefs.1211/e24401/pagehelp/Userpreferencestitle.html

choices.E: Add a server to an existing cluster
choices.B: Create a new JDBC data source

questions.question_text:
Consider an application that comprises both web and EJB components.
What are two benefits of implementing a multitier cluster architecture over a single-tier(basic) cluster architecture? (Chose two.)

choices.A: Dynamic clusters are only supported for the multitier architecture
choices.D: Future web clusters can share the same EJB tier
choices.E: All servers can be managed (started/stopped) together
choices.C: Each cluster can be scaled independently
